unit_learning_outcomes.description: Work with version control, configuration management, unit/regression testing, issue tracking, and debugging tools.
Demonstrate an understanding of software engineering culture and form camaraderie.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Class preparation, reading, review, programming and self-study

assessments.assessment_title: Working in teams on a substantial software engineering project
assessments.description: Students work in groups to develop week-by-week a software engineering project, both learning the principles and practices of software engineering, and gaining an overview of a wide range of software engineering areas (that are studied in much greater depth in individual units later in their program).
An opportunity to demonstrate the learning achieved in the second half of the unit's lectures
An invigilated examination of the unit's content.
An opportunity to demonstrate the learning achieved in the first half of the unit's lectures

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances
data.subject_search_title: COMP1050 - Introduction to the Study of Software Engineering
data.description: This units covers the fundamentals of software engineering, including understanding system requirements, finding appropriate engineering compromises, learning software engineering culture, forming camaraderie, understanding basic methods of design, coding, and testing, team software development, and the application of engineering tools.
data.search_title: COMP1050 - Introduction to the Study of Software Engineering
